wikitext.*:
'''Emyn Eglain''', or the '''Hills of Eglamar''', was a range of hills located in the land of the [[Falas]] in southwestern [[Beleriand]]. The hills only appear on a map and are never mentioned in any narrative.<ref name=WJBeleriand>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, pp. 184, 189</ref>

==Etymology==
The name ''Emyn Eglain'' means "Hills of the Forsaken (Elves)" in [[Sindarin]], from ''[[amon|emyn]]'' ("hill") and ''[[Falathrim#Names|Eglain]]'' ("the Forsaken"). The name ''Eglamar'' is, as noted by [[Christopher Tolkien]], "one of the oldest names in <nowiki>[</nowiki>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s<nowiki>]</nowiki> ''[[legendarium]]''" (for other applications, cf. [[Eglamar (disambiguation)]]).<ref name=WJBeleriand/>
